The XYFitter Object¶

When fitting data, an XYFitter object is used behind the scenes. It contains the functionality to fit data to a number of built-in functions, or have the user define their own.

class qexpy.fitting.XYFitter(model=None, parguess=None, name=None, sigmas=1.0)[source]¶

A class to fit an XYDatatset to a function/model using scipy.optimize

Parameters:
  • model (Function) – The model (linear, gaussian...) to be fit to the data.
  • parguess (list) – Guesses for the parameters of the fit.
  • name (str) – The name of the fit.
  • sigmas (int) – The number of sigmas to show in the error band.
fit(dataset, fit_range=None, fit_count=0, name=None)[source]¶

Perform a fit of the fit_function to a data set.

Parameters:
  • dataset (XYDatatset) – The dataset to be fit.
  • fit_range (list) – The range to plot the fit on.
  • fit_count (int) – The number of the fit.
  • name (str) – The name of the fit function.
